文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk2
证据片段: Nodular corrosion susceptibility of specimens was evaluated by corrosion tests in high-temperature high-pressure steam.

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk2
证据片段: The distribution profile of alloying element concentrations exhibited a normal distribution for all specimens, excepting Lot B, which showed heavy nodule formation in the corrosion test and had a nearly log-normal distribution

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk2
证据片段: A specimen having a larger variance in iron, chromium, and nickel concentrations showed heavier nodular corrosion in high-temperature high-pressure steam

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk3
证据片段: Lot C specimen showed a circumferential discontinuity in nodular corrosion

证据片段: Alloying element distribution maps within a 2.5 mm-square area are shown in Fig. 8

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk3
证据片段: Comparison of the variances between the regions of Lot C showed a small difference, which was slightly larger for the heavy nodule region than for the other one

STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk5
证据片段: Electron microscope techniques were used to investigate black and white oxide films, formed before and after the oxidation transition, on Zircaloy-2 in superheated steam at 673 and 773 K

文献ID: STP1023-EB-Zirconium in the Nuclear Industry_8th Volume_024_chunk5
证据片段: A compressive stress gradient distributed through the thickness of black oxide films was measured to be ~500 MPa/μm in films with a thickness of 1.2 μm
